org.openmuc.iec62056

Class Iec62056Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmuc.iec62056.Iec62056Builder

  • public class Iec62056Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a serial communication port that can be used to read meters using IEC 62056-21 modes A, B, C or D. Create and open a port using Iec62056Builder.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Iec62056Builder create(java.lang.String serialPortName)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create an Iec62056Port builder.
        Parameters:
        serialPortName - examples for serial port identifiers on Linux are "/dev/ttyS0" or "/dev/ttyUSB0" and on Windows "COM1"
        Returns:
        The builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setDeviceAddress

        public Iec62056Builder setDeviceAddress(java.lang.String deviceAddress)
        Set the device address which is transmitted as part of the request message that is sent to the meter.

        The default value is the empty string.

        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - the device address
        Returns:
        the builder

      • setPassword

        public Iec62056Builder setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Set the device password which will be sent after entering programming mode.

        The default value is null, indicating to skip the programming mode initiation.

        Parameters:
        password - the device password
        Returns:
        the builder

      • setMsgStartChars

        public Iec62056Builder setMsgStartChars(java.lang.String msgStartChars)
        Sets the IdentificationRequest start characters.

        Default value is: /?

        Parameters:
        msgStartChars - characters at the start of a IdentificationRequest
        Returns:
        the builder

      • setBaudRate

        public Iec62056Builder setBaudRate(int baudRate)
        Set the initial baud rate.

        The default is 300 baud for modes A, B, and C and 2400 baud for mode D. This function allows to change the initial baud rate in case the meter does not use the default initial baud rate.

        Parameters:
        baudRate - the initial baud rate
        Returns:
        the builder

      • setBaudRateChangeDelay

        public Iec62056Builder setBaudRateChangeDelay(int baudRateChangeDelay)
        Set the time in ms to wait before changing the baud rate during message exchange. This parameter can usually be set to zero for regular serial ports. If a USB to serial converter is used, you might have to use a delay of around 250ms because otherwise the baud rate is changed before the previous message (i.e. the acknowledgment) has been completely sent.

        The default value is 0.

        Parameters:
        baudRateChangeDelay - the baud rate change delay
        Returns:
        the builder

      • enableBaudRateHandshake

        public Iec62056Builder enableBaudRateHandshake(boolean baudRateHandshake)
        Enable an initial handshake to negotiate the Baud Rate.

        In mode C communication starts with baud rate 300 and then by default changes to a baud rate suggested by the meter. Enable the handshake if the baud rate shall be changed.

        Parameters:
        baudRateHandshake - if true enable fixed baud rate
        Returns:
        the builder

      • setTimeout

        public Iec62056Builder setTimeout(int timeout)
        Set the maximum time in ms to wait for new data from the remote device. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

        The default value is 5000 (= 5 seconds).

        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time in ms to wait for new data.
        Returns:
        the builder

      • build

        public Iec62056 build()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Build and open the Iec62056Port.
        Returns:
        the opened Iec62056Port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while opening the associated serial port (e.g. when the serial port is occupied).
